thread.title: New travel order to apply to those seeking new visas from 6 Muslim-majority countries
thread.title_full: New travel order to apply to those seeking new visas from 6 Muslim-majority countries

title: New travel order to apply to those seeking new visas from 6 Muslim-majority countries
text:
EMBED </> More News Videos <iframe width="476" height="267" src="http://abc7.com/video/embed/?pid=1786710" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe> 
A revised executive order temporarily barring the entry of people from certain Muslim-majority countries and halting the nation's refugee program is set to go to President Donald Trump soon. (KABC) AP Monday, March 06, 2017 07:13AM WASHINGTON -- President Donald Trump's new travel ban order will temporarily halt entries to the United States for people from six Muslim-majority countries who are seeking new visas.That's according to a fact sheet distributed to lawmakers and obtained by The Associated Press.Trump will sign the order on Monday. The new directive aims to address legal issues that arose from the original order, which was blocked by the courts.According to the fact sheet, people from Sudan, Syria, Iran, Libya, Somalia and Yemen who do not currently have valid visas will be blocked from coming to the U.S. for 90 days.Iraq was originally included on the list of banned countries. But according to the fact sheet, Iraq was removed from the order after agreeing to increase cooperation with the U.S. government on vetting of its citizens applying for a travel visa.
